title: About
text: Reilley Barish is a University of Nebraska-Lincoln Sophomore. She is a double major in sports media and communication as well as advertising and public relations. She is pursuing a minor in English. Reilley is from Marion, Iowa and grew up a Iowa Hawkeye fan but she now realizes that the Nebraska Cornhuskers are truly the better team. Reilley’s dream job is in social media for a sports team. Knowing data is a big part of the social media world. Here is where Reilley shows off her sports analytic side and how to interpret and understand data.

title: Do Freshman Kill More Than Seniors in NCAA Volleyball?
text:
Freshman like Harper Murray, Olivia Babcock and Torrey Stafford had taken over the 2023 NCAA volleyball season, from amazing kills to jaw-dropping plays. There is no doubt that they are the best of the best but we cannot forget about the seniors that lead the team.
Seniors like Valeria Vazquez Gomez, Temi Thomas-Ailara, Molly Phillips and Devyn Robinson. They helped redefine the game of volleyball.
In order to determine the best players we need to look at the best of teams. Let’s focus on the 2023 NCAA Final Four Teams. Nebraska Cornhuskers, Pittsburgh Panthers, Wisconsin Badgers and Texas Longhorns.
Our data is Sports Data Files of the 2023 NCAA volleyball season courtesy of Professor Matt Waite. https://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/ncaa_womens_volleyball_playerstats_2023


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
library(ggplot2)
library(ggalt)


Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt':
  method                  from   
  grid.draw.absoluteGrob  ggplot2
  grobHeight.absoluteGrob ggplot2
  grobWidth.absoluteGrob  ggplot2
  grobX.absoluteGrob      ggplot2
  grobY.absoluteGrob      ggplot2


Code
library(ggtext)




Code
data <- read_csv ("https://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/ncaa_womens_volleyball_playerstats_2023.csv")


Rows: 5363 Columns: 34
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (7): team, full_name, roster_name, last_name, first_name, yr, pos
dbl (24): season, jersey, feet, inches, gp, gs, mp, s, kills, errors, total_...
lgl  (3): ms, tb, total_blocks

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.




Code
season <- data |>
  select(team, full_name, yr, pos, kills, errors, total_attacks, hit_pct, s) |>
  filter(pos %in% c("OH", "OPP", "RS"), 
         team %in% c("Pittsburgh Panthers","Nebraska Huskers", "Wisconsin Badgers", "Texas Longhorns")) 




Code
plkills <- season |>
  group_by(yr, team, full_name) |>
  summarize(totkills = sum(kills)) |>
  filter(totkills > 86.94779)


`summarise()` has grouped output by 'yr', 'team'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.


Code
avgkills <- data |> summarise(mean(kills))




Code
nu <- plkills |>
  filter(
    team == "Nebraska Huskers"
  )
tx <- plkills |>
  filter(
    team == "Texas Longhorns"
  )
wi <- plkills |>
  filter(
    team == "Wisconsin Badgers"
  )
pp <- plkills |>
  filter(
    team == "Pittsburgh Panthers"
  )

frnu <- plkills |> 
  filter (
    full_name == "Harper Murray"
  )
frpp <- plkills |> 
  filter (
    full_name %in% c("Olivia Babcock", "Torrey Stafford")
  )
srwi <- plkills |>
  filter (
    full_name %in% c("Temi Thomas-Ailara", "Devyn Robinson")
  )
srtx <- plkills |> 
  filter (
    full_name == "Molly Phillips"
  )
srpp <- plkills |> 
  filter (
    full_name == "Valeria Vazquez Gomez"
  )




Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=nu, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills)) +
  geom_bar(data=frnu, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills), fill="red") +   
  labs(
    x="Player Name", 
    y="Total Kills", 
    title="Nebraska Cornhuskers Total Kills by Players", 
    subtitle="Harper Murray dominates as a <span style = 'color:red;'>freshman</span>, for Nebraska finishing second for total kills.", 
    caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
    )+
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple()
  )









Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=wi, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills)) +
  geom_bar(data=srwi, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills), fill="blue") +
  labs(
    x="Player Name", 
    y="Total Kills", 
    title="Wisconsin Badgers Total Kills by Players", 
    subtitle="Temi Thomas-Ailara and Devyn Robinson were key <span style = 'color:blue;'>seniors</span> in helping lead the Badgers to the Final Four, even with less kills.", 
    caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
    ) +
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple()
  )









Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=tx, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills))+
  geom_bar(data=srtx, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills), fill="blue") +
  labs(
    x="Player Name", 
    y="Total Kills", 
    title="Texas Longhorns Total Kills by Players", 
    subtitle="The Longhorns was led by their star player Madisen Skinner, who was a junior and would return for next season. Molly Phillips, while lowest in kills, was a huge <span style = 'color:blue;'>senior</span> to lose. ", 
    caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
    )+
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple()
  )









Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=pp, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills)) +
  geom_bar(data=srpp, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills), fill="blue") +
  geom_bar(data=frpp, aes(x=reorder(full_name, totkills), weight=totkills), fill="red") +
  labs(
    x="Player Name", 
    y="Total Kills", 
    title="Pittsburgh Panthers Total Kills by Players", 
    subtitle="The Panthers were unique with their <span style = 'color:red;'>freshman</span>, Stafford and Babcock, leading the way and their <span style = 'color:blue;'>senior</span>, Vazquez Gomez, being the main anchor of the team.", 
    caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
    )+
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox_simple()
  )











Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=season, 
    aes(x=yr, y=kills, size=s), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.3)

title: SportsBlogBarish
